number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 13, 2015



YouTube™ Video: Random Opinion: First Impression of Enclave 

			Views: 70		

			http://www.gog.com/game/enclave http://store.steampowered.com/app/253980/ Follow me on Twitter: https://twitter.com/Little_B_Gaming Check out my friend bambeast27 channel for some awesome videos:...		

I didn't finish the game, so keep that in mindHave you ever wanted to like a game, that looks fun and you hope it really is, but in the end you got bored and never finish it? I'm sure you have. This is the case with Enclave for me. After 6 h (around half of the game, I think) I just stop playing it. The game is not bad, but few things I don't like, contribute for my boredom.For such an old game it have a lot of video options. Resolution, separated menus for graphics and textures, sliders for sound and music and even syncing with refresh rate. Last but not least, you can rebind keys, use a controller, on and of damage number indicator and so on. But make no mistake, the game is ugly, but not unbearably ugly. Graphics didn't age very well, textures are bad, enemies tends to jump really high, levels don't have enough details, but it's an old game, so it's expected. The story is simple – you have to save the world and it is the worst part of the game. There somewhat interesstig backstory, but the developer didn't capitalized the fun premise. In the end, one can say it is absent. Even other reviews pointed this. It is cliché fantasy story, not develop enough.So, next is gameplay. It is where I had some fun and there is a lot to talk about. Here you can find some interesting ideas – character classes and fighting system. Let's dive in.The game have two campaigns – Light and Dark. As far as my knowledge, first you have to start with the Light and beat it to unlock the Dark. Enclave is hack 'n slash third-person action game with options for first-person, focusing on strategic combat for melee classes. If you enter thinking that this is similar to Devil May Cry or Dynasty Warriors, you will be killed really fast. The combat is slow and methodical. I think the best comparison is Dark Souls, but probably not that hard. Your shield is valuable as much as your weapons. The game is tough, but I can say with some patience every challenge can be overcome. The character you start is a Knight class. He is using melee weapons primarily. When you enter a battle, it's with your shield raised. You have to keep track of enemy hit patterns to find when is the best time to strike. You have to be patience. Interesting thing here is that size matters. What I mean is you may raise your shield, but your feet and head are not protected. You have to consider where to put it. In the beginning you will encounter short imp-like creatures and lowering the shield is crucial and vice versa. If your characters is short, taller enemies are easy. You can even use the terrain at your advantage, if you manage to get the enemy on higher ground. When using a melee weapon you can do a three hit combo and with every hit your damage increase, but it leaves open for attack. So, it's up to you to decide do more damage or hit once and bring up the shield. It's risk-reward situation. Depending on your movement, you make a different swing with the weapon and this add to the strategic gameplay.Through the most of my play time, I used the Knight class. At some point I decide to see the other classes. What I found is range classes are boring. The combat with them is like any other third-person shooter and they weren't interesting as melee classes.Every character have a melee and range weapon, but depending on the class, they are specialize in certain play style, so don't expect Knight class, for example, to get the best range weapons and vice versa. And speaking of classes, they are total of 12, but you don't get them right away, you will unlock them by playing the game. I don't like that. Why? What is the point of that? Unlock them from the beginning. But there is one interesting thing about that. You don't level up by getting XP. You just have to gatter gold for new gear. And since this is the case, the dev decide after each level, for all unlocked classes, you will get additional money, so you can swap character before entering a level and not playing the whole game again. New gear is unlocked by beating a level. This is all it required. They don't have statistic, so i assume, if it's cost more, it's better. Weapons include swords, crossbows, maces, bows, axes and so on. Some classes have can equip additional stuff like bombs, different types of arrows and so on.One of the things I don't like is the AI. I feel enemies can walk only in a straight line and when get the chance I use this the get them to suicide or to stuck in the environment. The other thing is range enemies. Their projectiles can go through solid surfaces and it was annoying. The third things is the level design. Building after building after building. There are some places like vulcano and small harbor town. Although their design is somewhat diverse, in the end I find it boring and not very inspired.Enemies are not very creative. Small imp-like creatures, orc without armor, orcs with armor and shield, big ogres, spell casting enemy and so on. But most disappointg are the bosses. I only saw two. They also have uninspired design and they are boring to fight.Sound design is meh. Noting to remember. Music feels like typical for fantasy game, sound fx are okay and the voice acting is average. Don't expect something groundbreaking or something to remember here.I'm somewhere in the middle about this game. Although old, there is something to see, something to enjoy. Melee characters are worth playing in my opinion. Everything else is like sound and level design, some of the classes, the AI are average and story – completely forgetable. I couldn't bring my self the finish the whole game. I almost reach half of the journey and got bored, so take my opinion with a pinch of salt. Nothing exciting happened during my time with the game. There is enough here that pushed me away, but it still have my cautious recommendation. Get it on sale. Why I recommend it? Because I can see something that others might enjoy, but not me. Melee classes have more interesting play style, than the others. The game is not garbage, I had some fun, but there is nothing here that could hold my attention for a long period of time. Maybe someday I will revist it to see if I can enjoy it more and finish it.

content:
Posted: November 27, 2015
												[ENG] Seriously, if it wasn't for reading it was released in 2003 i would have no mercy, but let's be objective.The gameplay is banal without attention to details, the graphic overall is ok (considering the old release date) but the shadows are so bad quality that i'd prefer playing without them. The menu interface is also something really unpleasant, it's rough because it's a scripted video as background, so it results in a real bad interface. Perhaps the storyline could be interesting, but i can't judge the plot because i'm not going to finish this game.Maybe it's just me, but i find this title so empty, i just don't feel to play it anymore. Just leaving it in background for steam cards.Guess this is one of those games that only old-gen guys who played it during childhood can enjoy it, in fact i never heard of it.[ITA] Seriamente, se non era per aver visto la data di pubblicazione del 2003 non avrei avuto nessuna pietà nel scrivere questa recensione, tuttavia sarò obiettivo.Trovo il gameplay molto banale e non curato, la grafica tutto sommato (considerando che è del 2003) è ok, ma le ombre sono un qualcosa di veramente fatto male che preferirei godermi il titolo senza esse. L'interfaccia del menu è veramente sgradevole, questo perchè è stato impostato un video scriptato come sfondo, risultando in un'interfaccia esteticamente rozza.Forse la trama sarà interessante, ma non posso valutarla poichè non avrò intenzione di finire questo gioco.Forse sono io, ma trovo questo gioco così vuoto, non mi dà proprio nessuna sensazione, nessuna voglia di continuarlo. Lo lascierò in background solo per le carte di Steam...Immagino che comunque questo sia uno di quei giochi che solamente i ragazzi della vecchia generazione che magari lo hanno giocato durante l'infanzia possano apprezzarlo.

number of helpful: 2 of 5 people (40%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: February 20, 2016
												I thought that this will be a fun game despite of its bad graphics because it's an old game. I was wrong. Actually, i want to finish the game before even reviewing this game, but i can't really stand it anymore.This game doesn't have any RPG or adventure feeling at all; you have to beat a stage in order to continue the other stage. Your map is limited to the stage and there is nothing to explore at all (except if looking for coin can be called as exploring).Just as the other reviews said, melee is really a bad choice in this game. Sometimes the hit isn't registering at all, forcing you to take some damage. The swings have a long animation which could render the shield useless because you hardly can use it (unless if you play it slow).I want to say that bow is a good choice in this game, but sadly, (again), the animation is very slow, not to mention that there are delays between shots. Your walking speed is slow, which means that you can't really use it for a very long time, which is a bad thing. I doubt that there is a head shot though, but i think there is an area where you can deal more damage on the enemy (maybe the head? who knows.)Well, despite all that, i must say that the environment and sound really create a good atmosphere to the game. You really can feel the environment to the bone. I can't really deny that i somewhat enjoy it up to some point, although it's crumbled with the very poor battle mechanic.Pros:- Two campaigns, lots of stages.- You can choose the difficulty level.- Multiple characters available.- Secondary weapon available.- Great atmosphere.Cons:- Long and slow attack animation speed.- Slow movement speed.- Bad graphics.- Auto death in some stage (yes, forced restart) if you fall in a pit or such.- Camera rotation suck.I might redo this review when i finished the game. But for the time being, this is how i think about it.There are tons of better games out there rather than this game. This game might be good in 2003, but it's not in 2016.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 27, 2013
												Considering this game originally came out in 2003, it's a classic gem for many of the 90's children. The game still has that unique feeling back from the glory days, but naturally any old game from today's perspective can't meet the standards of most modern games.STORYIn a fantasy setting, you can experience both good and evil campaigns of the same story with different outcomes. I found it very exciting, that at some points, the storyline for the unique campaigns collide and you get to kill "your good side character" in the evil campaign plot. Overall the plot is a bit generic, but serves it's function as intended.GAMEPLAYDuring both campaigns, you can choose 1 character to complete missions. You have access to 3 warrior, 1 archer and 2  mage type characters. I really missed some stealth mechanics, because the archer could have been an even better class, it already has a very tactical setup with over 4 or 5 arrow types. The mage is a bit overpowered mid game and the warriors are near invincible at the very end.The game features a "collectible - upgrade" system, there are many gems and gold hidden during the levels, which can be used to get better weapons and gear. Getting 100% on each level can be challenging, so you will be revisiting levels quite a lot.COMBATEasy to learn, it can be a bit strange the first time, I always thought the whole melee combat was a bit odd. The archer class might have a little learning curve, but the other classes are easy to play. There are little additions in the form of explosives and flame bombs that mix up the warrior classes.Considering 10 years have past since it's initial release, I was still able to enjoy playing this game, so I would give it a 8/10, given what you can expect from an old game to deliver.

number of helpful: 1 of 3 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 31, 2016
												The combat in this game is very clunky and simple. There's no real strategy to it, you just run up and spam left click to do your combos. You can use a shield but it isn't very useful since it doesn't knock an enemy back when they hit it or stun them. You will often find your strikes missing even though you can clearly see that your weapon hit the enemy. Just assume that your weapon is always half as long as it looks to be. Your enemies are also usually just as fast if not faster than you. Once they get close there's no escaping them, they'll stick to you like a tick until you kill them. That can be pretty annoying when you have to fight groups of enemies at once. I got this for 59 cents and for its time I can see that it would have been a good game but melee combat has become more complex since then. It all feels very dated and is honestly pretty boring.

content:
Posted: August 26, 2016
Product received for free
												Enclave is a 13-year old game which was defined as an RPG, although I think it is more of an Action-RPG. The game is consideribly good considering the time period in which it was released and offered me quite a bit of fun.Pros:-Reasonably easy to play, linear story and closed maps, so no getting lost or searching for objective-Combat is fairly simple and with the right loadout, you can defeat anything quite easily-Trading cards are available, and the game comes at a reasonable priceCons:-Graphics and sound is dated, so might not appeal to some in that sense-Mouse sensitivity issues, can be corrected setting it to 125Hz-Although the game is widescreen enabled, the menus are locked to 4:3 aspect ratio-Game becomes repitive and tiring after some time, you do the same things over and over againThe game is okay considering its time, if you are into old games, get it (DLH.net was giving free keys out a while ago). For the more modern gamer, I advise you steer clear5/10

content:
Posted: February 14, 2016
												A basic non rpg hack and slash puzzle game with lots of problems and lack of imagination. As for graphics they aren't bad, sound is ok, but gameplay is horrible. You basically get to gather gold coins while you kill some monsters in the "levels" which allow you to pick weapons and armor for your level playthroughs. Combat is as simple as face the monster and push the mouse button until dead. You have range combat which is ok for sniping at the start of encounters that you can snipe, a early headshot gives you extra damage, plus some foes like archers like to sit out of melee range requiring you to use a ranged weapon often.Now as to the bad parts, the game really is just "go through the level kill any foes that are there and collect gold coins". Thats it. Its like Mario with sword and crossbow. Your goal is to get all the gold coins in the level and finish it, which will unlock other characters to play, and lets you choose better items during each mission beiefing. The bad part about the game is that there isn't really any save points other than start mission-finish mission. If you die during the mission either 1 of 2 things happen. 1, if you didn't reach a "checkpoint" you have to redo the whole mission from start. If you did reach a checkpoint, you rez at the checkpoint, but lose gold, which means you can't collect all the gold coins in the mission which is why you are doing the mission in the first place, thus, making you restart from the beginning.This is especially annoying in missions where the bad jump mechanics make you fall down a hole and die often, or hit a trap badly, or something else making you pull your hair out having to re-do missions over and over from the very beginning. Sadlly this bad game mechanic made me quit the game very early just gritting my teeth over "hey, we are going to make a badly designed jump mechanic in the game, which by the way will get you killed a lot making you restart that annoying mission where you have bad jump mechanics to die, over and over. Have fun.". Sorry, not fun, and I didn't think twice after quitting and deleting the game and moving on to a much better game.

content:
Posted: November 24, 2015
												This game is a single player hack and slash 3D fantasy game. Imagine linear skyrim from 2003, mixed with elements of counter strike. You play as a hero you chose, saving your city from invaders. If you want to cut, shoot, burn, corrode, blow up, or squash orcs, goblins, sorcerers, golems and other monsters, this game is for you. After you beat the good side, you can also play as the evil side, taking over the city and cutting, shooting, burning, corroding, blowing up, or squashing humans for a change.Pros Interesting Story, provides backstory Many classes Customization Beautiful Scenery Amazing physics Multiple Storylines Level replayability Optional first personNeutral Checkpoints respawn you as you died, without resetting, leaving the world as it was on death.Cons Glitchy JumpingOverall, I really enjoy this game.Edit: The adware is gone, so you can ignore reviews solely complaining of that.

content:
Posted: August 26, 2016
Product received for free
												Enclave is a 13-year old game which was defined as an RPG, although I think it is more of an Action-RPG. The game is consideribly good considering the time period in which it was released and offered me quite a bit of fun.Pros:-Reasonably easy to play, linear story and closed maps, so no getting lost or searching for objective-Combat is fairly simple and with the right loadout, you can defeat anything quite easily-Trading cards are available, and the game comes at a reasonable priceCons:-Graphics and sound is dated, so might not appeal to some in that sense-Mouse sensitivity issues, can be corrected setting it to 125Hz-Although the game is widescreen enabled, the menus are locked to 4:3 aspect ratio-Game becomes repitive and tiring after some time, you do the same things over and over againThe game is okay considering its time, if you are into old games, get it (DLH.net was giving free keys out a while ago). For the more modern gamer, I advise you steer clear5/10

content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												Enclave is a fantasy action game. You unlock new characters with different weapons and abilities as you play and depending on your saved budget and unlocked items, you can equip your selected character with a choice of weps, armor and potions, and thats pretty much all the "rpg" aspect.The game has a story which is not bad but pretty basic and you can play it from the perspective of two opposing factions, you can chose the "light" or dark" campaign at the begining of the game and you will get to play different characters with different stories.The game stands out by its very well made fantasy setting and an excellent soundtrack. Personally i found the graphics and the music to be outstanding back in the day.The graphics aged of course but they aged quite well, for the most part they look good even by today standards. They might be technically dated but artistically they are still great.The combat is solid and quite varied for a hack and slash game. The choice of character is vital because the game is pretty difficult and some characters will do a lot better than others in certain levels. Every level can be completed with any character but the difference in difficulty can be unforgiving.The levels are not very big but most of them are intricated enough to allow some exploration in search for hidden stuff.It was one of my fave PC action games back in 2003 but i still enjoy playing it today.

content:
Posted: February 27, 2015
												Hey everyone and this is my review about the game!This is a really old action rpg  game.Interface/Menu/Settings2 Different Campaigns.There is a difficulty settings available.You are able to play with your controller.There are some different resolution sizes available.You can play in windowed mode or fullscreen mode.There is a brightness volume slidebar available.There is a sound volume slidebar available.There is a music volume slidebar available.You are able to toggle Blood, Damage indicators or subtitles.About the game.The game is really old as the game is released in the year 2003. This is a simple RPG action game with subjectives and other situations. The game could be really buggy at times or something will happen and you will raise your eyebrow. If you grew up and played this game in your childhood then you will know what to expect. But if you do not know the game at all then i would consider to buy this game with a discount.You are able to skip cutscenes.There are different classes and characters to be unlocked.Some parts has been voiced-over.There are checkpoints available.Graphics and soundtrack is okay.Levels are short and sceneries are basically the same or bland.Camera is third person and there is fall damage.You are able to see the enemy Health bar.Combat doesn't feel smooth and crossbow doesn't have a zoom-in which makes it difficult to use.There are collectables in the game. You are able to find gold which you can use to upgrade things.Other things.One orc was able to hold an entire battering ram all by himself to break down a door.-------------------I Give this game a 3/10

content:
Posted: May 18, 2015
												EnclaveControls: 82/100 Mouse+KeyboardLeft mouse click to attack Right mouse hold to Block attacks/Interact with Stuff and Npc, WASD to Walk, Q to switch weapons Space to jump. Esc for menu. C to Crouch. E to Drink Potion.  F to Use Item. Here's a user Manual for those who haven't seen it. http://cdn.akamai.steamstatic.com/steam/apps/253980/manuals/Enclave%20Manual%20Eng.pdf?t=1426600956Audio: 76/100The Music is great but sometimes gets out of theme the sounds are perfect. Voice could have done better I still liked follow along the story linesGraphics: 34/100The graphics are Outdated the developer should update the textures and everything or Remake the game a better version of it with amazing graphics. This game might be old but its worth playingBalance Between Challenging and Impossible: 54/100 (Don't count as points)When I played this game at first it was going pretty much I got lost and stuck on some parts since there was no hints to help me out to complete a certain part of a room like the first level I went back and forth just to figure out that the answer was to use the cannon to blow up a door.. I thought it was not useable since it didn't hint me well. At the moment I'm stuck at the part where I need to bring the old man a log which again have no hint where it is.Other: 45/100I understand that the game has some potential but when you collide with npc you get almost completely stuck until you force the npc out your way Plus the camera views are a bit bad I would recommend this game to those who love old gaming.Rated 237/400

content:
Posted: July 13, 2014
												A decent enough little hack & slash rpg. The combat is a bit...basic to say the least and the AI isn't the greatest. The graphics are decent given the time it was made. The enemies that I have encoutered have all been basic fantasy-ish baddies which is probably to be expected. The biggest gribes, in my opinion, is the story and the voice acting. Moreso the voice acting. The story is pretty much just your average fantasy dribble and is totally forgettable. And, the voce acting at it's best is 'meh' but most of the time it's somewhat of a cringe fest. So, yeah, like I said before this is a decent enough little game. It keeps you entertained and, really, isn't that what a game is for?6.5/10 - I wouldn't pay over what Steam is asking for it but I'd probably wait for it to go on sale.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 14, 2014
												If you're looking for a deep, story driven game, then don't buy this one. However, if you're looking for something to kill time...or looking for a game with a very loose story but mostly serves as an excuse to grind through kills...then go ahead and buy this game. I admit, I haven't played this game for long, so I could very well be proven wrong, but it's maybe worth about the $5 I paid for it. I can't say I love it, and I can't say I hate it. All I can say is...meh. It's OK. The good is the graphics are good for the age of the game and you can (once you have ground your way through campaigns to collect all the characters), play a character to fit your play style. The combat mechanics are simple, but solid. The bad news is it is a bit samey-same and it is, so far a bit of a grind. I can only hope it gets better...at which point I will happily admit I'm wrong, but at first blush it really isn't much to sing about. PIty I can only choose between two options here...thumbs up or thumbs down. We really do need a so-so option. I'll go ahead and give this a thumbs up, but with one caveat...if it's more than a few bucks you may be over spending. But if this is your thing, then go for it. It's good, mindless entertainment.

content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												One of these great games underated you should play at least 'cause of action/adventure gameplay basis it founded !It's a well managed port of an 1st & 3rd person action rpg xbox game... To be honest, this pc version has way better optimized graphics and controls than this last one. Kinda précious thing i could estimate while todays developers are not getting confortable with pc for mercantile and pessimistic reasons.Graphics are clearly outdated from nowadays, lots of clipping, little bit tearing when speeding up camera movement, global cubic rendering but it also works like a charm. Textures are clean even if obsolete and non-HD designed. The game offers quite a few graphical settings very pleasant for a console port. Generally, the good quality  level design and architecture serves the medieval fantastic ambiance, environments are inspired and never get redundant. Levels stay linear but some of them are very wide-open ans submited to a labyrinthine path, so it's easy to walk round while you are looking tirelessly for a wood key that will bring you to the next room.Gameplay is very interesting and fun. As you complete levels , the game gives ability to unlock and play characters with its own skills, and retribute you with coins you gather during the mission. Indeed, before each mission, a menu lets users spend budget in new weapons such as enchanted crossbows, tremendous magical swords, big boom bombs, powerful magical sticks, warrior armors,... Each of these new supplies has a certain cost and doing the cupid globetrotter roaming through the entire level will make you quickly one of the best bashing champions all over the enclave. In game, controls are very reactive but aiming is a little bit buggy ; the shots given by your character don't reach ennemy each time you wanna touch its, in fact lots of shots with no damage are expected.The game has a very hard feeling mostly because of this part of the gameplay. It remains thought fairy difficult and at any moment, it become nonsense of frustration as demon's souls can be often.Soundtrack is a classical variety of dark medieval themes and participates in making the ambiance immersive. However, it is repetitive to hear all the same themes for differents levels so It doesn't offer necessarily an audio consistency to each level that make this boring and annoying after hours. Vocal dubbing is correct, voices actors are convinient despite conviction missing for some of them.Two campaigns : light and darkness... Very cute and original. Player start first with the light campaign which has a storyline better exploited, longer and devoided with narrative ellipses instead of dark campaign less rich lingering on crucial moments that can be rapidly sent over.Now it's your turn to save people of the light and/or darkness... And kill them above all, that's the real purpose and leitmotiv of this outlet epic game !

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												+ Fun and fast paced combat.+ Interesting plot.+ Beautiful game for its time (2002).+ Unique gold and character system.  Instead of sticking to a character from start till end, the player can switch classes and equipments at will before the beginning of every stage.  No need to replay the whole game to try different classes, yay!- No autosaves, so this game is hardcore (but it can also be a good thing!)  There are checkpoints in the longer stages, though it takes a while to get to them.- Crashes on me 50% of the time.  Despite the frequent crashes, I still play Enclave because it's just that awesome.  Go ahead and grab it during sale!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												Enclave is a fun action game in a fantasy setting (though I wouldn't call it an RPG). You can find it cheap (sometimes FREE if you look around), and for such a low/no cost it's worth a playthrough.Pros:Action-packed combatSome environment interaction (exploding barrels, siege weapons)Decent story/loreHidden areas to promote explorationWell-designed maps/levelsYou can play the game from two "sides" (good and evil), with different objectives.Cons:Less gear options than expected (especially since any progression is gear-based)Only 1 character to start with (unlock others as you play)Some areas are very difficult using certain charactersYou must complete the first campaign to unlock the second one (IIRC)No controller support (but it plays fine on KBM)Most multicore systems will freak out the game. You can run it on a single processor though (the forums have info on how to do this).My biggest complaint is that the game has no multiplayer, which would've been amazing as a battle arena/map feature. Otherwise, it's a decent game for a few hours of fun.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												Fun and easy to play. Run around in 3rd person with a character chosen from an ever-growing band of classic fantasy heroes (or villains, after 1st playthrough). Swing your medieval killing tool of choice. Or zap some fireballs if you selected a mage. Jump and dodge, explore and run some more. Soup up with new maces and mail afterwards.Repeat for two campaigns a ~12 maps each.Everything is pretty solid- puzzles, character/monster design, pacing, even the music. Combat is VERY basic. No complicated combos, chains or counters.Enclave aged relatively well since...a) its a small niche b) the character designs are rather decent and c) -that is the game's main strength- Enclave did aim low but totally gets it right.Verdict:Hideous paws arrange 3/5 skulls for Vatar's throne.

content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												Fun Hack and Slash action adventure with that certain Conan the Barbarian fantasy pulp feel.Evil is afoot or whatever so you kill stuff. Theres no leveling, you pick up gold in the levels which after completion gets added to a total you use to not really but kinda buy and sell - its more of a point limit you get to spend on equipment. For example with 100 gold you could equip a sword and armor for both 50 or a bow for 100. Theres usually one checkpoint each level (no quicksaves) and dieing means losing 10 gold - if you manage to find the checkpoint, else game over.Theres multiple character types to unlock altho some are just straight upgrades (in one case not strangely).Levels are well designed and varied, for such an old game it really looks amazing if you put all the sliders to the right. Gameplaywise it starts out abit slow but picks up pace along with higher difficulty. Melee fighting is rather simplistic tho, you can block and do a 3 strike combo. Something seems off with hitboxes, i had attacks whiff which really should have connected, this is especially noticeable using bows and such in very close range, shots pass right thru enemies if you dont aim at their feet or in first person. Annyoing but workable.Other minor cons:- very crashy if not in XP compatibility mode which breaks the steam overlay- rename or delete install.vdf in the reg folder in the games folder or have a steam store page for some♥♥♥♥♥♥open each time you start thisIf you remember Severance: Blade of Darkness - this is kinda a lite version. Good fun, recommended.

content:
Posted: December 9, 2014
												+ Fun and fast paced combat.+ Interesting plot.+ Beautiful game for its time (2002).+ Unique gold and character system.  Instead of sticking to a character from start till end, the player can switch classes and equipments at will before the beginning of every stage.  No need to replay the whole game to try different classes, yay!- No autosaves, so this game is hardcore (but it can also be a good thing!)  There are checkpoints in the longer stages, though it takes a while to get to them.- Crashes on me 50% of the time.  Despite the frequent crashes, I still play Enclave because it's just that awesome.  Go ahead and grab it during sale!

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: December 31, 2014
												Enclave is a fun action game in a fantasy setting (though I wouldn't call it an RPG). You can find it cheap (sometimes FREE if you look around), and for such a low/no cost it's worth a playthrough.Pros:Action-packed combatSome environment interaction (exploding barrels, siege weapons)Decent story/loreHidden areas to promote explorationWell-designed maps/levelsYou can play the game from two "sides" (good and evil), with different objectives.Cons:Less gear options than expected (especially since any progression is gear-based)Only 1 character to start with (unlock others as you play)Some areas are very difficult using certain charactersYou must complete the first campaign to unlock the second one (IIRC)No controller support (but it plays fine on KBM)Most multicore systems will freak out the game. You can run it on a single processor though (the forums have info on how to do this).My biggest complaint is that the game has no multiplayer, which would've been amazing as a battle arena/map feature. Otherwise, it's a decent game for a few hours of fun.

content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												Enjoyable.Though it is indeed generic and brings nothing new to the table, It's a fun game to play and beat over the weekend.I like the devision of classes, adds a lot of replayability and makes the game a lot more dynamic in terms of gameplay.Having played it on normal difficulty I found the difficulty to be fair, perhaps a bit easy at times. Luckily there is also a hard difficulty setting for those looking for more of a challenge. I will say that the AI tends to be a bit dumb at times. I occasionally encountered enemies simply standing still waiting for me to kill them, falling to thier deaths, or just jumping around like idiots with no purpose. Also, they seem to find it difficult to climb up stairs, ending up jumping back and forth.I dislike some of the level design, at certain points it was very unclear to me in which direction I should be heading or what I am currently supposed to be looking for. I basically just ended up running around until I found my way, but sometimes it could take up to several minutes which was very tedious.Overall it's a solid game. 7/10

content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
												Este un joc de actiune la persoana a treia in care poti juca atat de partea binelui cat si de partea raului intr-un conflict de proportii epice. Cu toate ca incepi cu un singur caracter posibil, mai departe salvezi alte personaje de diferite clase cu care poti juca. Un punct in minus este acela ca in lupte loviturile sunt imprecise. Cateodata sagetile si sabiile vor trece prin inamici fara a provoca lovituri iar inamicii pot lovii scutul si cu toate acestea sa iti ia din viata. Caracterele nu se misca prea repede si dureaza ceva pana incarca de exemplu arcul cu o noua sageata. Caracterul tau poate lua si bea potiuni de viata dar si aceasta actiune este foarte lenta, asemenea luptelor, schimbarii armelor, deci potiunile mai bine le lasi dupa ce eliberezi zona de inamici. Jocul este destul de dificil, deoarece te poti rani usor in cursele intinse pe parcursul jocului si daca te aventurezi direct in lupta poti fi incolnjurat de inamici de unde poti scapa foarte greu. Grafica: 5/5, Game play: 4/5, Storyline: 4/5, Sunet/ muzica : 5/5, Prezentare: 4/5.

content:
Posted: October 22, 2016
												It's not bad, but not great either. I don't see any popup ads, the game looks decent in 1080p, and it runs fine on my 8 core Windows 10 computer. So all those old problems must have been fixed.I'm 9 levels in, I've unlocked most of the characters. The melee fighting never gets good, eventually your weapon will one hit kill most enemies, except a few stronger ones with 10x more hitpoints. I can only kill them with ranged weapons and running away. Killing them with a sword doesn't work because their AI spams their attack nonstop, and their attack is just as fast as yours, so you end up trading damage - which could work if you buy lots of potions.The third person crossbow shooting is kind of fun, and the level designs are interesting.It's a decent game if you like third person shooters and can get it on sale or in a bundle.

number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 17, 2016
												This game can be a steal in steam sales periods. Going for only 49 cents.This game is extremely nostalgic. Back in 2002 this game had a demo with only 2 playable levels. It was one of the most downloaded demo's on the site games.telenet.be. :) I loved that site. I didn't have internet at home, so a friend of mine burned the demo on a disc for me. Sadly I never found a physical copy of the game in stores. The graphics. I love these kind graphics but I don't like hack n slash games. Especially when they are top down (Diablo, Torchlight...). Since this is a 3th person game, It's forgivable. At the time I thought hacknslash was awesome. This is a kind of game they don't make anymore. A lineair action game. Follow the path, kill everybody, progress through the story.  Repeat till you see the credits. The sword fighting feels a little bit like the Jedi Knight series btw...It's an ok game. At 50 cents it's a steal.

												One of these great games underated you should play at least 'cause of action/adventure gameplay basis it founded !It's a well managed port of an 1st & 3rd person action rpg xbox game... To be honest, this pc version has way better optimized graphics and controls than this last one. Kinda précious thing i could estimate while todays developers are not getting confortable with pc for mercantile and pessimistic reasons.Graphics are clearly outdated from nowadays, lots of clipping, little bit tearing when speeding up camera movement, global cubic rendering but it also works like a charm. Textures are clean even if obsolete and non-HD designed. The game offers quite a few graphical settings very pleasant for a console port. Generally, the good quality  level design and architecture serves the medieval fantastic ambiance, environments are inspired and never get redundant. Levels stay linear but some of them are very wide-open ans submited to a labyrinthine path, so it's easy to walk round while you are looking tirelessly for a wood key that will bring you to the next room.Gameplay is very interesting and fun. As you complete levels , the game gives ability to unlock and play characters with its own skills, and retribute you with coins you gather during the mission. Indeed, before each mission, a menu lets users spend budget in new weapons such as enchanted crossbows, tremendous magical swords, big boom bombs, powerful magical sticks, warrior armors,... Each of these new supplies has a certain cost and doing the cupid globetrotter roaming through the entire level will make you quickly one of the best bashing champions all over the enclave. In game, controls are very reactive but aiming is a little bit buggy ; the shots given by your character don't reach ennemy each time you wanna touch its, in fact lots of shots with no damage are expected.The game has a very hard feeling mostly because of this part of the gameplay. It remains thought fairy difficult and at any moment, it become nonsense of frustration as demon's souls can be often.Soundtrack is a classical variety of dark medieval themes and participates in making the ambiance immersive. However, it is repetitive to hear all the same themes for differents levels so It doesn't offer necessarily an audio consistency to each level that make this boring and annoying after hours. Vocal dubbing is correct, voices actors are convinient despite conviction missing for some of them.Two campaigns : light and darkness... Very cute and original. Player start first with the light campaign which has a storyline better exploited, longer and devoided with narrative ellipses instead of dark campaign less rich lingering on crucial moments that can be rapidly sent over.Now it's your turn to save people of the light and/or darkness... And kill them above all, that's the real purpose and leitmotiv of this outlet epic game !

content:
Posted: April 9, 2016
												Encalve is a great game for what it is - an action focussed Hack and Slash. There's no character development but you find money on levels which you can buy better gear with. This creates a cool puzzle/platform element as it's no easy task to find it all as there are some very interesting places the money is stored. I played this a lot years ago and on the hardest difficulty it will give you a run for your money. It's of an older vein of games that will be frustrating at first as you need to place arrows carefully and time your swings exactly or you'll be flailing around hitting nothing.2 Campaigns with plenty of replayability due to around 6 different characters for both the light and dark faction. They basically mirror each other - so there's a warrior/archer/wizard/engineer/etc for both factions. Each character requires a different play style as you can imagine and get some unique equipment that you can buy.I was pretty excited that this was on discount on steam - 47p or thereabouts. However I've only been playing about 30 mins and the game crashed on the second level. Tried again and crashed right at the end again. Very frustrating -- and I imagine all support for the game will be gone now so no hope of a fix. The error message only flashed up for a brief second so apologise for not giving the exact error. Hopefully it's just me but worth bearing in mind if you're paying full price.For what is a game you'll easily get 40 hours playtime out of, it's a shame that the steam version seems a little unstable.The game itself is a solid 7/10

content:
Posted: December 6, 2013
												Enjoyable.Though it is indeed generic and brings nothing new to the table, It's a fun game to play and beat over the weekend.I like the devision of classes, adds a lot of replayability and makes the game a lot more dynamic in terms of gameplay.Having played it on normal difficulty I found the difficulty to be fair, perhaps a bit easy at times. Luckily there is also a hard difficulty setting for those looking for more of a challenge. I will say that the AI tends to be a bit dumb at times. I occasionally encountered enemies simply standing still waiting for me to kill them, falling to thier deaths, or just jumping around like idiots with no purpose. Also, they seem to find it difficult to climb up stairs, ending up jumping back and forth.I dislike some of the level design, at certain points it was very unclear to me in which direction I should be heading or what I am currently supposed to be looking for. I basically just ended up running around until I found my way, but sometimes it could take up to several minutes which was very tedious.Overall it's a solid game. 7/10

content:
Posted: June 21, 2014
												Fun and easy to play. Run around in 3rd person with a character chosen from an ever-growing band of classic fantasy heroes (or villains, after 1st playthrough). Swing your medieval killing tool of choice. Or zap some fireballs if you selected a mage. Jump and dodge, explore and run some more. Soup up with new maces and mail afterwards.Repeat for two campaigns a ~12 maps each.Everything is pretty solid- puzzles, character/monster design, pacing, even the music. Combat is VERY basic. No complicated combos, chains or counters.Enclave aged relatively well since...a) its a small niche b) the character designs are rather decent and c) -that is the game's main strength- Enclave did aim low but totally gets it right.Verdict:Hideous paws arrange 3/5 skulls for Vatar's throne.

content:
Posted: January 26, 2015
												So I got this game for $0.82 during the final days of a christmas sale, and I thought "for 82 cents I don't expect much. I didn't get more than about 8-15 minutes in before I got bored and gave up to go play some Super Hexagon instead. Controls are acceptable. atmosphere, which is glorified in the trailer and the description, is as atmospheric and interesting as a generic action/adventure game of the later 90's. The actual gameplay is fine, the graphics are quite dated and the overall quality of the game is subpar, but not bad. It's not a matter of graphics or controls with this game, so much as its fault being in its boring landscapes, strangely disjointed combat and utterly generic feel. Nothing interesting, new, innovative or even remotely eye-catching is done with this game. It rides its way comfortably into the safe zone of action/adventure gaming set in a bland and uninteresting medevial world devoid of anything that might make it stand out of the hundreds of its boring and generic cousins at the bottom of the value priced games you find in a cardboard bin at a department store, left to wallow in all they're boring blandness. for $0.82, it is ok, but for full price of $5.60, I think I would rather go have some tempura dynamite sushi..Better that awful, but can't muster the strength to jump over that "Berlin Wall of Generic Gaming" fence - 5.5/10

												I love Enclave. It's a dumb hack 'n' slash but with a great soundtrack and atmosphere. Though the character models don't hold up well (they weren't great for the time) the environments are amazing. It's a button masher with simple upgrades. There's light exploration but you can't get lost. The story is pretty generic action fantasy stuff. There isn't much else to say about Enclave. It's cheap and well worth it if you dig this kind of run around and kill everything sort of thing. You either "get" this game or you don't. Also, it runs on Linux using a Wine wrapper. Other than a brightness glitch when changing video settings, that disappered once I restarted the game, it runs great on Elementary OS (Ubuntu 14.04 LTS).

												A quite nice little game with a decent selection of characters over two campaigns. It is an old game and in a lot of ways it really shows, it's really not all the complex, but it's got a fun mission-based bite sized approach and the gold system it uses allows for experimenting without being punished. number of helpful: 0 of 1 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: December 16, 2014
												Fun Hack and Slash action adventure with that certain Conan the Barbarian fantasy pulp feel.Evil is afoot or whatever so you kill stuff. Theres no leveling, you pick up gold in the levels which after completion gets added to a total you use to not really but kinda buy and sell - its more of a point limit you get to spend on equipment. For example with 100 gold you could equip a sword and armor for both 50 or a bow for 100. Theres usually one checkpoint each level (no quicksaves) and dieing means losing 10 gold - if you manage to find the checkpoint, else game over.Theres multiple character types to unlock altho some are just straight upgrades (in one case not strangely).Levels are well designed and varied, for such an old game it really looks amazing if you put all the sliders to the right. Gameplaywise it starts out abit slow but picks up pace along with higher difficulty. Melee fighting is rather simplistic tho, you can block and do a 3 strike combo. Something seems off with hitboxes, i had attacks whiff which really should have connected, this is especially noticeable using bows and such in very close range, shots pass right thru enemies if you dont aim at their feet or in first person. Annyoing but workable.Other minor cons:- very crashy if not in XP compatibility mode which breaks the steam overlay- rename or delete install.vdf in the reg folder in the games folder or have a steam store page for some♥♥♥♥♥♥open each time you start thisIf you remember Severance: Blade of Darkness - this is kinda a lite version. Good fun, recommended.

number of helpful: 27 of 56 people (48%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: September 5, 2014
												Before you make your descision on buying it or not it is VERY IMPORTANT to know that this game came out in over 10 years ago, in 2003(?), meaning that if you need your fix for high graphics, walk away now. It's not that they are bad or are comparable to a game like Nidhogg, however you are able to see it's age by all of the flat and repeating textures, lack of any anti alising and even a few very pixely items.It also has to be mentioned that the menus do not have mouse support, meaning you have to use the arrow keys, Enter and Esc to navigate the menus.That being said Enclave can be a fairly fun experience if you enjoy it's combat and exploration, the only problem being that the combat is very simple, somewhat cluncky and even unreliable as far as the hitboxes go when it comes to using ranged weapons close up to enemies. No matter who you choose to play as (will be explained upon better later in the review) it feels like an M1 spam fest as that is your only way of attacking with your sword/axe/hammer/dagger. Your other other ways of doing damage is (depending on the character) by pulling out your crossbow/bow/staff, and pressing M1. For it's time it was OK however in a day and age where we have a long list of games with numerous abilities and ways of doing damage, Enclave begins to show it's age. Though it has to be said that the combat is fairly satisfying. When you pull off a combo (depending on the weapon, M1 x Type Of Melee Weapon) the last hit will do double damage, and even give the attack splash damage so any nearby enemy will also take damage. This alone isn't much, but paired with a nice 'smashing' sound and a little bit of screen shake, it truely does feel good when you finish off multiple enemies with your final swing.Exploration is a different story, whereas the age of Enclave has been hurting it, Enclave shows how older games did their exploration and it made you want to explore the land you were put in. When you start a mission you are put inside a medium/large sized area where there are a number of pickups that will become extremely important in your journey through each level, and ultimately the game itself. You will come across ammo pick ups for your crossbow/bow (may you have one on you or not), health potions, checkpoints and even gold. The health potions and ammo are given and taken away on a mission by mission basis, where you can find 3 potions in a mission, however they will be taken away after the mission is over.The gold on the other hand is collected and kept for a equipment screen you will use before each mission. When you select your mission, you will be given the option of who you want to use for that mission. Each character has their own loadout (the Druid is the only one who can use staffs, etc.) that you can fill up, which is where the gold comes into play. You use the gold as more of a borrowing system then a buying system seeing as you choose your items from the equipment screen by just swapping through them, taking or returning gold depending on the quaility/quantity of the item. An easier way of thinking of it is by switching out gold with a weight system. Instead of gaining +5 gold, you picked up +5 max weight, allowing you to use better/more weapons/armour/ammo/health potions. The better equipment comes back to help you complete more difficult missions and get more gold.If you enjoyed playing through the game once then you will be very happy to know that there are actually TWO campaigns to Enclave, the Light side where you face the forces of evil, and a more difficult Dark campaign where you face the forces of good. Besides that there are hoard mode missions on both sides of of the game where you face increasingly difficult groups of enemies to gain gold for the main missions and other hoard missions. These missions can be found by finding maps in the main missions which will open up a new spot on the mission select screen.All in all, Enclave can be a fun game if you can get past the fact that it's over 10 years old and has nearly everything that comes with it being old. Personally I wouldn't buy it for $5.00 US dollars, but if you can get it while it's on sale (75%+), then I would recommend giving it at least an hour of your time just so you can at least experience what Enclave has to offer. It's not a bad game, it's just dated.

number of helpful: 11 of 24 people (46%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 20, 2014
												It's fun, but there are some really cheesy issues.  Aiming is awful, and even if your reticle "guarantees" a hit by turning red, you may still miss.  There are some suddenly falling floors or traps in the game that lead to instant death, which is fairly sinful in a game that requires you start the entire stage over upon character death.  Melee attacking has its own problems too, in that every encounter is basically a slap fight with weapons.  Hit detection is iffy and any nuance like spacing or positioning is out the window.  Click, click, click.  Beyond that, the game is still fun and looks ok, player models aside. I can't recommend this to anyone but the morbidly interested.   It's not all bad, but it would have been a 6/10 in 2002.  If you just need something to play, then maybe go for it?  Or work on your backlog first, you lazy bum.

number of helpful: 32 of 67 people (48%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 2, 2014
												Bought it during the halloween sale for less than a dollar and, considering the number of positive reviews, it really looked like a good deal. Well, I decided to write this review so you won't be fooled by the people who say the game is awesome and looks good even for 2014 standards. That's not true at all. In fact, the graphics are really, really outdated. I could live with that, but unfortunately this game has a number of serious and infuriating issues.First, they use a script to shove ADs down your throat. EVERY TIME you click the "Play" button, it will open a browser tab and show the steam page for a different game from the same company. That could create a stupid situation in which you have the game loading in the foreground and a video loading in the background at the same time - IF I could get the game to load right from start. For some reason, though, I have to kill the game process and start it again, otherwise the game simply won't open. As a result, it will load the same steam page TWICE. Can we have a round of applause for that awful business decision? They managed to make me hate their company even before I could load up the game for the first time, and that is something not even Electronic Arts had done before. Impressive. Well, after actually loading the game, I found out it's quite generic and unimaginative. There's some loooong narration to set the scenario but it's not particularlly interesting or engaging. The battles are boring and repetitive. Run up to an enemy, hit him, step back. Rinse, repeat. And you'll have to repeat that a lot, because the hit boxes are very small and it's very common to miss swings that should have connected.I couldn't feel a real sense of progression. There are no shopkeepers, but you can buy your equipment from a virtual shop before starting a mission. Didn't find any loot besides coin, potion and the starting sword/shield. There's a limited amount of money you can find in each level too. So far the game looks ugly and boring, but those are subjective aspects and they might not prevent you from actually enjoying Enclave. However, there is a very objective issue that can and most likely will ruin your day.  Enclave has a tendency to crash with a message that says "UNRECOVERABLE ERROR FOUND, press any key to close". It can happen anywhere, any time, for any reason or for no reason at all. Well, if you're thinking "I could live with the occasional crash", think again, because you cannot save the game. There are a few checkpoints scattered around the maps and you will respawn in one of them if you die, but if the game crashes, all your progress is lost - you will have to restart the mission from the beginning. All the puzzles, all the enemies, all the traps and doors - you will have to do everything again. Unfortunately, the game crashes frequently. It happened six times in the two hours I tried to play. I wanted to keep going but it felt like a chore and I wasn't having fun anymore. I didn't have great expectations (it was only a dollar after all), but  Enclave still managed to let me down. I can't in good faith recommend this game.

number of helpful: 3 of 8 people (38%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: January 5, 2015
												If you look for a good RPG/ARPG or Hack-n-slash - you've taken a wrong turn.First and only reason why is game is not even remotely worth your attention - this is a bad port from original xbox game.1) There's no proper gamepad support, at least I didn't manage to make it usable with both x-input and d-input. What make matters worse - game doesn't react to keyboard keys bound to gamepad buttons, so I had to stick with mouse + KB. And yes, you cannot use mouse in main menu (makes sense since it's a console game in first place).2) The gameplay itself constantly suffers from random camera spins, random teleportation of your character and sometimes illogical reaction to commands - it can react slowly to button presses, it can execute your attacks way faster than usual. Hitboxes are quite off as well, in fact they are so off from visuals that it's obvious just a few minutes into the game.I see no point in describing the gameplay itself since I didn't see much, the only thing I can point out is that the combat is really too simple and narrows down to some kind of hit-n-run M1 spam, ranged weapons are almost unusable due to technical issues described earlier. Character development is also pretty much non-existent. Probably was okay for 2003, but now I'd not recommend playing it.

number of helpful: 2 of 6 people (33%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: November 9, 2015
												tl;dr version first:+ Solid graphics that aged pretty well+ Serviceable music+ Okay level design(Yes, the only positives are still just "OK" and not great...)- Literally everything else:- Terrible clunky controls- Overly simplistic and boring combat- Generic medieval fantasy setting- Even more generic story- Voice acting ranges between mediocre to comically badDetailed version:Someone gifted me a free key, so I went in with an open mind and low standards, and... it's still pretty terrible. I absolutely don't mind older games, and still play games from several generations ago and still enjoy them, but this is beyond janky. The controls are atrocious, even for the time. Older games like Soul Reaver and Ocarina of Time still manage to have fluid and serviceable melee combat and character movement and they aren't even necessarily purely combat-driven; this  is a hack-and-slash with little else than combat, yet it moves horribly stiffly, the hack and slash combat is repetitive and boring, and the hitboxes are a total joke. Ranged combat is even worse, aiming is clunky and painful. I didn't even get far enough to try any kind of magic, though I unlocked a druidess (who honestly looked more like a stripper than any kind of priestess or adventurer) but I was too bored to bother continuing.I don't know why this is tagged as an RPG, this is a hack-and-slash action/adventure game (which isn't necessarily a bad thing, I love those too, but don't go in expecting an RPG); there are no RPG elements such as stats, character progression, looting, story choices, etc. Missions are linear; you buy the best loadout you can afford, and go in (again I don't have a problem with that kind of structure, but don't expect tons of exploration or non-linear progression or anything like that), and levels are short, with okay level design I guess. The only gameplay element are killing boring monsters, sometimes jumping, and picking up gold and keys or flipping switches. Oh yeah, the second mission is an escort mission, and gods help you if the NPC AI decides to walk in straight into the monsters and get himself killed. Because yep, that can happen. Oh, you activated a checkpoint, and died? Cool, you lose a bit of gold, but respawn with everything else exactly as is, which in theory would be fine except... meanwhile monsters are attacking your NPC escort and you've failed the mission before getting back to where you were.  Oops?Don't waste your time on this mediocrity. Even if you're really really starving for an old-school hack-and-slash game, there are tons of better options out there. Like, say, any of the Ys games, or Dark Souls, Dragon's Dogma, Salt and Sanctuary, hell even the otherwise mediocre Bound By Flame and Lord of the Fallen are still much better than this.

content:
Posted: October 13, 2016
												It's a nice old game. The combat system works. No glitches so far. a mix of 3rd person hack & slash and a 1st person shooter. so far I have unlocked three characters warrior, archer, druid.... despite classes they are the same, just use different weapons. The gold serves as a sort of an XP system here... before each mission you can pick one character and use gold to choose their weapons... the higher the price the better the weapon... gold stacks up for the party and doesn't dissapear. so after each mission you have more gold for more equipment. there is at least one arena location with waves of ennemies and different difficulties.... all in all it's not a bad game from the old days... graphics are dated and so are the game mechanics but for the sake of old times I'd give this 7/10 Play it!!!

number of helpful: 1 of 4 people (25%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: April 7, 2015
												I am sorry to say this, but this is either the most broken game out of my selection or just the most un-directed game.What i mean:On the first level, the game did not tell you anything (besides from how to draw your weapons).I was practicly stuck on the first level for roughly 30 min. because i did not know what to do next. Also thought it was a glitch so i restarted it many times aswell.PS- I finally found that there was a lever that was at the first room with out any hint that it was there, besides from spamming MC2 (the use button in this game)On the second level, the main idea from the "compainion" was that you needed to defeat a few, easy monsters, simple right? Well yeah they were easy, but after you defeated them i could not go anyware, only advice from the so called "compainion" was "We need to protect the Outpost!" Well, ok, lets go! But there was nothing there, not even a letter or another monster to lead way, NOTHING! You could not go back where you came from or open or destroy any doors, so what then? Well i wasted another, rough 30 min (In my opinion) looking for something, and because i am pretty tolerant towards games i, restarted it many times to see if it was a glitch. NOPE . . .Disappointed in this game, had hopes for it.Although there are Pro's and Con's with every game here are a few i can sayPro'sConstant 60fps Note bad graphics for 2003Unique game style (names areas and ect.)Fast load time*For you to decide*Con'sNo help (beside from "what buttons do what")Short areasBad voice actors (sounds dull and not into the game style)Either buggy or hard (could just be me)*For you to decide*PS- These are just my opinions so do not take offence to this if you enjoy this game!

Posted: September 7, 2014
												One of those games where my memories of it were WAY better. Its too hard to get past the awkward "oldness" that permeates the game at every level. The crummy UI, ultra-shallow combat, imbalances, and the missions that fail to "pull you in" story-wise all just make the game feel dead and empty.Granted its usually on sale for less than a dollar. But mark my words. If you buy this, you'll be like "man i should have spent that dollar on something else."

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: October 13, 2014
												I already owned the game before I added it to Steam. For the time it was made the graphics were amazing and still hold their weight  today. Textures are crisp and I can play this game at 1080p with no issue, the only downside is FoV is locked, though at 95 it isn't that bad.  Story progression is ok. Light vs Dark and a rift that divides both. Unfortunately the rift is shrinking and both sides are now butting heads. I only wish the characters you meet in playing through the game had at least some back story or names, rather than just Warrior, Druid, Halfling, etc.. Combat is fine. Melee combat offers 3 weapon classes, Sword, Axe and Hammer.  Melee weapons also have some form of a combo in where if you swing successively 3 times it produces an end effect. Bows offer a wide range of ammunition from sniper bolts which lets you zoom in at far away targets, standard bolts that allow you to stack them up for a burst shot, fire bolts for damage over time, and explosive bolts for aoe damage. Crossbows are your medium ranged weapon and can be used by both ranged and melee classes. Staffs used by your mages offer a standard attack, close ranged aoe attack, and a shield to block melee and ranged hits.Character customization goes as far as how much gold you've collected in your play through. Gold acts a point system and it's scattered throughout the game world, some in pots and others in the form of gems.  The more gold you've collected the better things you can equip. This can range from better armor, weapons, shields, staffs, more ammo for bows, etc... I would say your bow users as well as your engineers/bombardiers are more demanding in gold requirements due to how much stuff they can equip while other classes like warriors don't require much at all. Gold you've collected stays with you for your entire progression. Also collecting it all awards something special in the end.The only sad part about this game is there's no multiplayer, which at the time would have been great as it looks like it could have supported at least 4 players (Just judging by the wave levels in the campaign). All in all it's a good game.I also still hope for an Enclave 2.

content:
Posted: June 15, 2015
MechanicsHave you ever swung a sword in a zero-grav environment? Well it feels that way, You do get used to it super fast and it's easy to look past.The movement/Mouse movement is actually really decent and better than I expected.Graphics & SoundsThe graphics are amazing for a game port that's over 10 years old! I personally adore the art/graphic styles.The shading is nice, the blood, and the enemies look nice as well! I'm actually very pleased with the "new" feel to it.The only issue with the graphics I have is they seem to degrade during cutscenes.I also dislike how the main menu screen is in a 4:3 ratio though if you have a 1080p res.The sounds are perfectly okay in my book for the type of game/way it was put together.GameplayThe story so far is nice and enjoyable, however it is very easy to get lost and no real indication that certain environment elements can harm you. (Which I love that, but I'd like a tiny heads up.)I spent my time feeling like I was playing a maze game running around trying to find the next area to enter. (I could just be blind.)I also find it funny that the goblins speak Swedish.OverallFor 5$ it's worth it, I'm enjoying it and I'll be returning to playing it shortly for the story.

number of helpful: 0 of 2 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: July 28, 2015
												I got this game for free off of DLH. It's a very old game (2002), and I'm mindful of that. It doesn't even seem to register that my mouse is there. My mouse is a Logitech (#1 brand, mind you) track ball. I'm fairly sure I bought it circa 2004. I've heard about the game having issues with newer laser mice, but with an eleven-year-old (optical) trackball? This thing works fine with DOS games, Win16 games, DirectX, Flash games, you name it. If a game can't deal with my aging USB mouse, there's probably something fairly wrong with said game.* My trackball IS attached to my keyboard's inbuilt USB hub, that's the only rationale I can imagine. Thing is, with the game being published in 2002, it HAS TO be a Windows app and not the last of the DOS games, right? Anyways, I'm uninstalling and giving it a thumbs down.

content:
Posted: December 20, 2015
												7/10 - An enclave you'll not regret to visit.Got this game in a bundle and what a pleasant surprise! Everything about this game is retro in the best possible way. The map design, the models, the graphics, the effects - it all has that 00s charm from games that made the best out of technical limitations.++PROS++ +The maps are actually pretty small but with every design trick in the book (the one still used for Half-Life maps) you can run around quite long until you've been to every corner. Maps are very diverse from temples, dungeons and caves over castles and even whole villages but due to the small size there are no wilderness areas.+Combat is rather demanding with melee weapons, bows and spells. Everytime you thought you found a working routine a new kind of enemy or tactical situation makes you throw it over board again.+There is a lot of action apart from combat, your character can swim, dive, jump ledges, climb ladders, and pull levers. There are several TR-like puzzles and on occassion you can use physics to kill enemies.+The menu is simple and accessbile and the controls work properly most of the time.+You get additional characters along the way (who sometimes accompany you in the maps you find them) and you can choose for each new map which cahracter should tackle it--CONS---The game is completely railroaded. Everytime you finish a map,a new one gets available.- Some of the characters you get to use are pretty useless- The range of equipment (different for most characters) is very underwhelming and there is actually not much choice how a character is equipped at every stage of the game- Sound effects are not good, Mostly a torch or waterfall is as loud in the next room as it was standing in front of it only to vanish completely once you're far away enough.- After a dozen maps or so it gets a little repetetive, I admit I haven't played it to the end.All in all I had a lot of fun and I can recommend it as one of the games to can play if you just have an hour or two and want some fast&fun action in between.

												     Quite an outstanding game! It has a perfect balance of Storyline and gameplay, but i does have a lack of tutorial. You will be aimlessly swinging your knights sword trying to figure out where the perfect point is. For being an old game, it has amazing graphics! Once you reach an area with lava, you will not mind being killed by enemies as the wonderfully colorful lava distracts you. This game has its surprises like random goblins and orcs jumping out of windows and bushes to try and scare you a bit, so it's never a dull moment.  Overall, i recommend picking this game up, you won't regret it!

number of helpful: 2 of 7 people (29%) found this review helpful1 person found this review funny
content:
Posted: September 2, 2014
												Ugh, this game...*In Jontrons voice* OOOHHHHHHHH! I picked it up for a buck, because why not, ya know? I saw the graphics, and said "Wow, this looks really good for 2003!" Well, looks and plays are two different things, my friend.To compliment this game, yes, it actually has very nice visuals. Nothing groundbreaking by todays standards, but for its time, they were pretty good. Aside from that? This is kinda terrible. But! it does fall under "So bad, it's good". The combat is just an M1 fest, with absolutely no strategy. Simplicity is one thing, but this is pretty braindead. Enemies either just stand there and take it or run. Actually, I gotta say, the combat reminds me of Kings Field on ps1...all the bad aspects of it. Run forward, slash once or twice, step backward, repeat. It's incredibily dull, to say the least. Oh, and hit collision is choppy.Not much to say about music or voice acting, nothing stood out. Nothing good, nothing horrible, it's all just kind of...there. The game is very linear. Now, I actually don't have a problem with a game being linear. However, this game is insultingly linear. Not Hallway Simulator 13 linear, mind you, but pretty damn close. Overall, Enclave feels kinda like the testing stages for a game. Like, they just finished the engine, impleminted the basic features, but shipped it out before it could be polished up. I guess I could compare it to a beat-em up, but without the satisfaction from said beating up. Can't say I recommened, Enclave, unless you feel like burning a dollar while it's on sale.

content:
Posted: November 9, 2014
												First off! only problem i have seen from the game, was the starting up the game, but the 1 thing i found REALLY a problem...the damn story's don't match up...play light...ok then you go to play dark guess what it seems dark has a time traveling portal that made you kill the light hero in mission 2(dark) then out of no where...your mission 9(dark) runs in with mission 2(light) where did that come from? and how the HELL did dark lose? if they got time travel? in light makes little sense...and the fact that...in some missions...you seen the same things happen from light end up in dark when the maps meet? other then that HOLY CRAP this is the 1 of the very few games that run smoother then hell! i have played torchlight 2...guess what little lag here little lag there...here epicly no lag 100% smooth play thru and best part is...i stayed up from 4PM to 9AM X_X beating both light and dark full gold! on my first play thru! :D it really kept my interest which not alot of games do these days! good work! hope i can see more of these smoothe games :3thing i think would be alot better...if the ranged people wouldn't bust sooo freaking much damage! in hard mode...i mean only toon i could kill them was the...knight...and the berserk the whole game X_X the archers are the WORSE they 1 shot even on easy :P cuz i did a 2nd run from hard to easy to see the damage differents holy crap do archers still 1 shot after mission 8 seems the only way to kill them is by melee block with shield then CHARGE them and...it seems the nightmares need a HELL of a nerf...hardmode...any armor...=1shot seems they got an attack no heros can do which is 100% ignore armor and dark side gets the worse of it WAVES ON WAVE ON WAVES ON WAVES!! in the dream mission :P on the escape mission...i believe i killed around...140? or so...before i noticed they don't end... i think over all...PC is better then xbox with this game :P and i can't believe it took me 9.4hours to 100% gold/bonus mission in both games xD IN HARDMODE! anyways this game was AWESOME!! in my opinion :) also...hint hint...if you disable the auto open browsers on your computer the ads go away :P

number of helpful: 0 of 3 people (0%) found this review helpful
content:
Posted: March 1, 2014
												Enclave is clearly a ported console game from a different generation.  While it permits key mapping, it fails to allow the player to save where they want; instead, it comes in episodes that must be finished before one's place is saved.The game fails to make much use of the mouse, relying largely on the mouse buttons to hit stuff and do things, while movement is keyboard based.  The game has "gold" scattered around each section, and keeps track of how much is available vs. how much the player has collected in some action game-esque scorekeeping.The real annoyance remains the "on-the-rails" style of play that Enclave delivers.  It's pretty, it seems to have its heart in the right place, but it gives the player no freedom.  One quest at a time, with marks for how much gold you collect, and then on to the next.  You cannot even open a door until the necessary trigger event(s) have been completed.To be honest, this is really not a game that I would call an RPG.  Action, yes.  Adventure, sure.  But it lacks most of what makes a good RPG - including multiple active quests and ability to stray from the path.  I didn't even see character building in the short time I spent in the Enclave world.I had such high hopes for this game, but it is time to resume the search for a good RPG.

												Enclave was one of Starbreeze's very first titles, and it kind of shows in a lot of ways.The game is an extremely average hack and slash. The more interesting one of the two, the Dark campaign, is not open to you until you complete the game once over.It's more or less one of those games that time forgot, and not one I'm particularly sad that it happened.

content:
Posted: December 21, 2013
												This game plays and feels like a proto Dark Souls style of game in the sense that death is meaningful but not too harsh and it being a kind of third person character game. Melee seems to be the only choice and the ranged combat is really finicky; as if something was lost in translation from its original console port over to PC. What makes the ranged combat difficult leads into a positive I found in the melee combat. Though many enemies are melee based they don't simply run straight at you and play as if it's a multiplayer melee combat where they'll constantly zig zag to avoid ranged attacks and circle strafe/ dodge in melee combat. Unfortunately this leads to the Elder Scrolls style of combat where I'm diving in and back-peddling to avoid hits; this makes up the majority of the combat I've played.
